generations.name: ABB LRV (5001–5035)
generations.description: The original 35 articulated light rail vehicles, numbered 5001–5035, were the first transit vehicles in the United States to employ AC propulsion. Each three-section car is powered via pantograph from 750V DC overhead catenary. They were the widest LRVs in the US at delivery at 9 ft 6 in.

generations.name: ADtranz LRV (5036–5053)
generations.description: 18 additional vehicles, numbered 5036–5053, were delivered in 1997–1999 to support the Hunt Valley extension and BWI Airport branch. Built by AAI Corporation under the ADtranz brand (successor to ABB Traction), they are functionally identical to the original fleet. The entire 53-car fleet is slated for replacement under the Light Rail Modernization Program.
